page.title: 13THE SMITHY,TWYFORD
page.content: The smithy has been at Twyford for over 200 years.It was origionally a blaksmiths workshop.The blacksmith used to shoe horses in the area and repair agricultural implements.Shoeing a horse would cost 12p in 1895,today it would cost over 15 pounds. Mr.Cox was the blacksmith who worked there in 1895.He successfully made an iron bicycle in his work shop but was not able to patent it quickly enough,Mr.Raleigh beat hin to it. After the blacksmiths was no longer used as a smithy it reverted to a family house.The present owners have unsuccessfully tried to convert it into a restaurant. There is no local blacksmith st the present time.
